meanings.definition: A group of pentapeptides found in the brain that act as neurotransmitters and have pain-relieving properties.
meanings.sent1: Enkephalins help reduce pain signals in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study enkephalins to understand how they relieve pain.
meanings.sent3: The enkephalins in the brain throw a party to celebrate blocking pain!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like enkephalins, easing the ache in his heart.
meanings.sent5: Imagine tiny enkephalins dancing happily in your brain, calming discomfort.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of endorphin-like peptides found in the brain and other tissues.
meanings.sent1: Enkephalins play a role in regulating mood and emotions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are fascinated by the functions of enkephalins in the body.
meanings.sent3: The enkephalins in the brain tell jokes to keep everyone in good spirits.
meanings.sent4: His laughter spread through the room like enkephalins, lifting everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: Picture colorful enkephalins swirling around, bringing joy and balance to your mind.
